ygData.subject: Re: Re: Possible reason invisibility fails sometimes
ygData.msgSnippet: It s Line of Sight. Hug the right wall as you pass the GIBs moving deeper into lower guk and none of them will aggro on you regardless of whether you have
ygData.messageBody:
It's Line of Sight. Hug the right wall as you pass the GIBs moving
deeper into lower guk and none of them will aggro on you regardless of
whether you have invis or not. If you don't hug the wall they will see
you and attack.

Ariell Thunderwolf, Karana

Robin Wise 3 wrote:
>
> >Message: 23
> > Date: Thu, 06 Jan 2000 12:06:21 -0700
> > From: Randy Keith <Kalekona@...>
> >Subject: Re: Possible reason invisibility fails sometimes
> >
> >Heh, Gibs see invis to undead. Period. =)
>
> Errr.... Not true. I've used ITU to walk past them several times with
> no
> effect. I've also had them attack me twice when ITU was up. This
> seems to
> support the idea that they simply have a higher-than average
> intelligence
> check against that spell, or that the "random" (hehehe) number
> generator
> just acted up.
>
> Something else I have noticed - bardic invisibility seems to be
> superior to
> any other single concealment spell (invisibility or invisibility to
> undead
> spells) insofar as it fails less often. Many's the time I've wandered
> Cazic
> or Unrest, dancing through the halls while around me monsters stood
> waiting.
> I don't ever recall anything in either of those zones seeing through
> my
> invis. Could be that our invisibility has a lower-than-average
> intelligence
> check...
>
> Aloro Silvertongue (E'ci)
